DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Point defects and pre-dose requirements for sensitization of the 300°C TL peak in natural quartz

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract This paper discusses the structural features required to stimulate a strong thermoluminescence (TL) glow peak near 300°C in clear natural quartz. For that reason, fresh TL data taken from several specimens prepared from five single crystals with known impurity content are shown. The TL emission was measured with a test dose of 10 mGy of γ-rays in the readout intervals 50?160 and 160?320°C. The readings were carried out prior and after the administration of a pre-dose of 175 kGy of γ-rays followed by heat-treatments at 400°C. For each single specimen, the OH content and the population of inclusions were evaluated by infrared spectroscopy and optical microscopy, respectively. The darkening induced by high γ dose was evaluated by optical spectroscopy. It was observed that the absorption at 475 nm and TL responses decrease with increase of the OH. It was shown that both smoky darkening and TL signals were better explained in terms of Li/Al and Li/OH content ratios rather than the absolute values of aluminum and alkali concentrations. The sensitization with high γ dose and heating is essential to create and stabilize a class of defects sites with Li+ ions dislodged from [AlO4/Li]0 and Li-dependent OH centers. It is suggested that the defect sites formed with Li+ act as electron traps during test dose irradiation, whereas electron-hole recombination occurs essentially at [AlO4]0 centers during the TL output near 300°C.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract This paper discusses the structural features required to stimulate a strong thermoluminescence (TL) glow peak near 300°C in clear natural quartz. For that reason, fresh TL data taken from several specimens prepared from five single crystals with known impurity content are shown. The TL emission was measured with a test dose of 10 mGy of γ-rays in the readout intervals 50?160 and 160?320°C. The readings were carried out prior and after the administration of a pre-dose of 175 kGy of γ-rays followed by heat-treatments at 400°C. For each single specimen, the OH content and the population of inclusions were evaluated by infrared spectroscopy and optical microscopy, respectively. The darkening induced by high γ dose was evaluated by optical spectroscopy. It was observed that the absorption at 475 nm and TL responses decrease with increase of the OH. It was shown that both smoky darkening and TL signals were better explained in terms of Li/Al and Li/OH content ratios rather than the absolute values of aluminum and alkali concentrations. The sensitization with high γ dose and heating is essential to create and stabilize a class of defects sites with Li+ ions dislodged from [AlO4/Li]0 and Li-dependent OH centers. It is suggested that the defect sites formed with Li+ act as electron traps during test dose irradiation, whereas electron-hole recombination occurs essentially at [AlO4]0 centers during the TL output near 300°C.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
It is known that the Imaging Plate (IP), employing the crystal luminescence phenomenon (BaFBr:Eu2+) has been tested as X-ray diffraction detector for the study of crystalline structures of biological materials successfully, X-ray scattering with synchrotron radiation and following characteristics were noted: IP has a very high sensitivity, reaching up to three orders of magnitude higher compared to a conventional X-ray film, large dynamic range, linearity and excellent spatial resolution of the order of 25 μm.
In the present work, in order to find new application and explore the limit of sensitivity of IP for industrial radiography, testing was conducted positioning X-ray radiation source generated by a battery powered up to ten meters far from the targeted composite materials used in wind turbine blades and extra-high voltage composite insulators. First, numerical simulations were conducted and to validate the simulation results, experimental testing was conducted in the laboratory.
As a result, X-ray source with 120 kV positioned up to five meters, high quality images were obtained with exposure time up to 5 minute using HD-CR 35 NDT IP reader. This high sensitivity of IP open new applications of inspection and monitoring the wind turbine blades, composite insulators and so on.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Defects Analysis in Composite Insulators Associated with Brittle Fracture Aged on 230 kV Overhead Transmission Lines by the Micro-Computed Tomography

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 12th ECNDT - European Congress on Nondestructive Testing
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: BINDT - British Institute of NDT

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In this work, two types of composite insulators of transmission line of 230 kV were inspected in laboratory using the technique of micro-computed tomography. One composite insulator aged for 6 years was removed after it showed three hot spots during a thermographic inspection at night, and another one was in operation for 10 years and was removed from in-service because composite rod of one of them fractured by the SCC brittle fracture mechanism.
The composite insulator that was inspected by thermography and showed three hot spots, two of them, showed the presence of defects, such as voids and detachment of silicone from composite rod. Furthermore, those defects are located in a position of injection mold of material used during the manufacturing of the insulator, that by the technique of segmentation and 3D reconstructions of the images, was possible to see clearly the mold geometry, detachment and distribution of voids inside. So, the hot spots in those two positions are attributed to partial discharge.
In the composite insulator that spent 10 years in-service and removed from the transmission line, after inspection by the micro-CT images showed presence of many fractures in the material that cover and protect the composite rod and those flaws are find perpendicularly to load due to the cable weight. The 3D images showed clearly that fracture are located only on the EPDM material region and some fractures start from interior to external surface.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Nondestructive Evaluation of Microstructural Defects in Aged GFRP Composite Insulators Employed in Extra High Voltage Transmission Lines by the 2D Imaging from X-Ray Refraction Topography

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 3rd International User Workshop on Coherent X-Ray Imaging and Small Angle X-Ray Scattering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The composite insulators made of Glass Fiber Reinforced Plastics (GFRP) are worldwide employed at the overhead transmission lines. Nowadays, more than 20 million units are in operation due to their several advantages in comparison to the traditional glass/ceramic insulators chain, such as high hydrophobicity in the location of high degree of pollution, low weight (1/10), less damaged by vandalism, however, there are two main critical failures: mechanical and electrical failures. The most critical failure is the mechanical due to the brittle fracture of composite rod when it is subjected to stress corrosion cracking (SCC). As a result, the conductor cables go to the ground. In case of the electrical failure resulting flashover, it is related to the loss of hydrophobilicty and considerable accumulation of pollution containing salts on the surface of a composite insulator. In order to mitigate the brittle fracture of composite insulators in the field, it is fundamental to understand the mechanism of brittle fracture of composite rod in detail. So, several composite insulators employed in 69 kV, 230 kV and 500 kV have been studied at Federal University of Pernambuco using digital radiography and micro-computed tomography, infrared thermography, mechanical toughness evaluation by Charpy test and the main results will be presented [1]. 
On the other hand, the nondestructive detection of microstrutural elements in composite insulators have not been conducted yet. But with extraordinary contrast of inner surfaces far from absorption effects, causing phase related effects such as refraction and total reflection at a few minutes of arc can be attained using X-ray refraction topography techniques based on USAXS (Ultra Small Angle Scattering) [2], because the refractive index of X-ray in matter is almost one. Furthermore, X-Y scanning of specimens can results in 2D imaging of closed and open pore, crack orientation and fiber/matrix debonding in plastics/polymers. So, X-ray

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 27 Congresso Internacional de Transporte Aquaviбrio, Construзгo Naval e Offshore
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: SOBENA - Sociedade Brasileira de Engenharia Naval

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: An engineer is required to have ability to learn and use science, ability to manage even such issues that can?t can not be solved only by knowledge of science, that is, creativity and ability to plan and conduct necessary tests. To cultivate develop such abilities of in a student, the traditional one-way education: a teacher gives knowledge to students, seems not to be enough. In an author?s experience in a private company, the most effective way for training a freshman into an engineer was the OJT (On the Job Training). The essence of OJT can be said ?to give him/her issues one by one: sometimes difficult and to let him/her work by himself/herself to complete the issues?. We have introduced the essence of the OJT into two classes (PBL classes) at UFPE: ?Design and Making of a Paper Glider? and ?Design and Making of Something to Save an Egg?. As a result, we have found the trial was successful.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Inspection of Weld Quality of Thick Shipbuilding Steel Plates by a Compact and High Sensitive Computed Radiographic System

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 27 Congresso Internacional de Transporte Aquaviбrio, Construзгo Naval e Offshore
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: SOBENA - Sociedade Brasileira de Engenharia Naval

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: AbstractNowadays, in the shipbuilding industries, the welding process is one the most important processes for joining and assembling of ships and platforms. Frequently, distortion results from the welding processes and affect the productivity of a ship in the shipyard. But another fundamental issue of concern in the shipbuilding and a big challenge issue, it is the inspection of weld quality of joints of the thick steel plates above 10 mm of thickness by the radiographic method. For a successful inspection of weld quality, usually, the radiographic inspection is conducted by using gamma-ray source (radioisotope) and X-ray film and it should be conducted in the late night due to the necessity to fulfill the requirements of radiation protection. In order to overcome these difficult, at the present work, aiming to conduct high quality radiographic inspection during the workday, results of weld inspection of weld of shipbuilding steel plates of 19 mm in the thickness, using a high sensitive and compact computed radiography system in the laboratory, with a battery powered portable X-ray source of up to 120 kV and an ultrahigh sensitive Imaging Plates, are presented. As a result, even though improvement in the digital radiographic system should be done, it was observed that use of a portable and low cost digital radiographic system aiming to evaluate the quality of weld of joint of thick shipbuilding steel plate is possible.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: A Study on a Hull Form with Lower Wave Making Resistance at Fourde Number Lower than 0.26

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 27 Congresso Internacional de Transporte Aquaviбrio, Construзгo Naval e Offshore
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: SOBENA - Sociedade Brasileira de Engenharia Naval

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We have a resistance test result on two model ships different each other at fore body form. The wave-making resistance of one of the two model ships is considerably lower compared with that of another one at the Froude number lower than 0.26. However, the reason why such a large difference in wave-making resistance has come out has not yet been clear. So, a theoretical study on the cause of the difference has been conducted. As a result, it has been clarified that the difference in the form of a part of fore body mainly causes such difference in wave-making resistance.
